abstract: This Monday puzzle starts with a knight’s competition.
snippet: This Monday puzzle starts with a knight’s competition.
lead_paragraph: It’s not often that a Monday puzzle breaks a record. Randall J. Hartman’s grid today contains four Double-J names, another J in the central answer word to name the theme, and two more bonus J’s in the top row for a total of 11, two more than the old maximum. Less than a year ago, he set the record for the most H’s, also on a Monday (Across Lite, Solution). I wonder if, like Sue Grafton, he plans to work through the whole alphabet.
